intro.name: Nikolay Trakiyski
intro.tagline: AI Solutions Architect | Product Manager | Low-code & Open-source addict

bio.title: BIO
bio.paragraph: I'm obsessed with solving problems by building things - not just managing them. I get energized when someone shows me a manual process that takes 3 hours and I can automate it in 30 minutes using AI and low-code tools, or when I can turn a struggling product around because I understand both what users actually need and how to build it technically. I'm the person who can speak fluent CEO, translate it into developer language, and then build the solution myself - which means faster decisions, shorter feedback loops, and products that actually solve the right problems.

jobs.title: AI Solutions Architect

points: Turned college graduates into independent developers in 3 months by refusing to give them simple answers and instead teaching them how to think through problems - they went from asking 'what should I do?' to presenting me with solution options and their reasoning
Built a multi-tenant Next.js application with AI integration that connected 4 different databases, RAG systems, and N8N workflows while the CEO was still explaining his vision in abstract terms

Created automated workflows that eliminated 80% of manual data processing by mapping out every step of existing processes and identifying exactly where humans were doing repetitive tasks that APIs could handle
Designed scalable infrastructure that could handle the CEO's '10,000 users' vision while actually working with our current 50 beta users - built for scale without over-engineering
summarizedPoints: Turned college graduates into independent developers in 3 months by teaching them how to think through problems, leading to solution proposals.
Built a multi-tenant Next.js app with AI integration, connecting 4 databases, RAG systems, and N8N workflows.
Automated workflows, eliminating 80% of manual data processing by identifying repetitive tasks suitable for API handling.
Designed scalable infrastructure for 10,000 users, balancing future growth with current needs of 50 beta users.

Modern Web Stack (Next.js, Shadcn, Clerk, Resend)

Built internal application that scaled across 30,000 employees by designing for the edge cases first (the unusual users in different departments) which made the common cases work perfectly
Proved I could handle multiple roles simultaneously while delivering better results than the previous specialized team - this led to my promotion to Senior Product Manager
summarizedPoints: Increased monthly active users by 150% in 2 months by focusing on actual user needs over stakeholder assumptions.
Translated executive vision into technical requirements, bridging communication gaps between VP of Product and developers.
Built a scalable internal application for 30,000 employees by prioritizing edge cases, ensuring broad functionality.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple roles, delivering superior results and earning a promotion to Senior Product Manager.

list.title: 1. Business-to-Technical Translation
list.description: Most people can either understand business requirements OR technical implementation. I spent 5 years deliberately learning both because I kept seeing projects fail at the translation layer. I can sit in a meeting where the CEO talks about 'revolutionizing customer experience' and walk out with a technical specification that developers can actually build. Proof: I've inherited 3 different 'stuck' projects and delivered results within 2 months each time by fixing the communication gap, not the technical problems.

list.title: 2. AI Integration and Process Automation
list.description: While others debate whether AI will replace jobs, I'm already building systems that make humans 10x more effective at their jobs. I map out manual processes, identify the repetitive parts, and build automated workflows using N8N, APIs, and AI that handle the boring stuff so humans can focus on creative problem-solving. Real example: I built an automated system that eliminated 80% of manual data entry across Gmail, Salesforce, and Instagram by understanding exactly what data moves where and why.

list.title: 3. Full-Stack Product Development
list.description: I don't just manage product development - I can build the entire product myself when needed. This isn't about showing off technical skills; it's about credibility. When I tell developers something will take 2 weeks, they believe me because I've built similar features. When I promise clients a feature, I know exactly what's involved. I can prototype solutions in days instead of months, which means faster validation and iteration cycles.

whyMe.title: What Makes Me Different
paragraphs: I test 2-3 new applications every day - not as a hobby, but as research. I approach each one with two minds: the curious user trying to understand the experience, and the developer reverse-engineering how it was built. This constant learning keeps me ahead of trends and gives me a massive toolkit of solutions I can adapt to new problems.

I refuse to be "just" a product manager or "just" a developer because the biggest value I bring is connecting different worlds. Companies hire specialists and then struggle to get them to work together effectively. I am the bridge - I can code the solution, manage the team building it, and explain to executives why it matters.
